wikipedia_page.main: John Hanmer, 1st Baron Hanmer (22 December 1809 – 8 March 1881), known as Sir John Hanmer, Bt, between 1828 and 1872, was a British politician.

response: * Bucknall Street – after either Arabella Bucknall (or Bucknell), mother of John Hanmer, 1st Baron Hanmer who owned this land in the 19th century,Fairfield, S. The Streets of London – A dictionary of the names and their origins, p47 or Ralph Bucknall, local 17th - 18th century vestrymanBebbington, G. (1972) London Street Names, p63
*22 December - John Hanmer, 1st Baron Hanmer, politician (died 1882)

Wingfield-Baker married Margaret Maria Hanmer, daughter of Lt.-Col. Thomas Hanmer and Arabella Charlotte Bucknall, in 1837, and sister of John Hanmer, 1st Baron Hanmer.  They had at least one child, a son, Captain Digby Hanmer Wingfield (d. 1884).  Wingfield-Baker died in 1880 from injuries sustained in hunting accident.
